reviewText: Postal 2 is one of those games that managed to ♥♥♥♥ people off to an extreme level, and also somehow slip through the cracks. reviewText: Postal, a series known for decent quality games with over the top humor [Postal 2] and extreme violence [Postal]. You play the roll of a man we only know as the Postal Dude (we'll just call him Dude, for short.) following his day to day tasks everyday for a week. These can range from picking up milk to going to go pick up a parcel, but they always wind up going wrong in the worst way possible. Being a large change, and in a way, a step up from the original isometric shooter before this. Taking a first person perspective this go round, we follow the Dude through Paradise, Arizona as he runs into (and subsequently becomes hated by) many groups. Such as, anti game protesters, rednecks, and anti book protesters to name a few. The weapons are far more out there since the first game, adding a infected cow head and napalm launcher, along with a few other goodies. All in all, if you're not easily offended by over the top humor or violence, then this game should already be in your library. You should also check out Paradise Lost, the story expansion of this game.

The Dude's commentaries and puns are hilarious and the voice fits this game perfectly.

This addition to the game is fun and fancy but it feels more like a standardl FPS (Half-Life

reviewText:
Postal 2 is an openworld-esque game in roughly the same sense that Deus Ex is: Fairly large maps with a loading screen every now and then. It's an errand objective based game spanning across 7 days in where you do a different set of errands in (mostly) any order each day. Errands, which go incredibly wrong most of the time, and involve very much violence.

The game has an inventory system of sorts with pretty much no limit except for ammocounts, items include things such as: Healing items ranging from a simple doughnut, to an overpowered health capping drug, as well as catnip which can be used as a bullet time drug, and cats which can literally be used as shotgun silencers. There's also healthkits you can pickup and use immediately, but not carry around in your inventory. The Postal Dude would rather carry an armada of cats and enough fastfood to kill America, but not something sensible like healthkits. Absolutely no complaints here.

This has something in common with Shadow Warrior and the Jedi Knight Star Wars games, in that they both have firearms and a really awesome melee weapon(s) you use all the time because it's more effective and more fun, and tons more of decapitations.

There's tons of melee weapons, guns, and things to set on fire. If you catch on fire, you can ♥♥♥♥ in the air to put yourself out. You can also pour gasoline everywhere in funny shapes and set it on fire to display something stupid, and then set everyone on fire. And then ♥♥♥♥ it all out.

At one point I got some soldiers I rescued from a secret terrorist base to sign a petition to make whiny old congressmen play violent video games. I couldn't be any happier when this happened.

The game's feel and engine is somewhere between Half-Life and Deus Ex and something else. Old crunchy feel to the levels (but not quite that old), and the silly movement bob when you move. Except Postal Dude can take seemingly even more damage than Gordon Freeman himself. All those years of drug abuse must have weaved some sort of kevlar equivalent into his skin or something.

Also, at one point, the developers amazingly decided to release an expansion for this game 10+ years after it came out, kind of like how Age of Empires II got new DLC itself. Still can't believe either of those happened.

Game kind of runs like trash at times, especially when too many NPCs are thinking, like fighting things and just generally freaking out. I've had 2 crashes in the main game in my roughly 12 hours of playing, so the game is stable enough.

So yeah, it's a violent classic. Go buy it and cause chaos, or be a pacifist and just do errands, or something.

reviewText:
This game is great. I love how many things you can do in it and how many hidden secrets this game has.
When you play on normal difficulty oh boy is it fun. But what happens when you turn Postal difficulty? The game is so much better then! For me the game was totally different. I had to explore much more places to get health and some ammo. I found many hidden easter eggs this way.

So, to summarize: I recommend you to play this game and try the Postal difficulty. It's fun and not that hard.

reviewText:
Postal 2 is not a good game. It's a very rough, outdated and primitive game. This doesn't mean it's not worth your time or money. Postal 2 is simply phenominal. The story is almost non-existent, you play as a middle aged american badass doing chores for his fat wife. You can do this peacefully like a goody two shoes or you can show some balls and shoot the ♥♥♥♥ out of everyone with plenty of unique and awesome weapons. You can ♥♥♥♥ on people, you can meet and/or brutally murder child star Gary Coleman, you can do just about anything you want. Postal 2 might have been poorly made with simple and glitchy graphics and gameplay, it may have horrible acting and bland characters and story events, but it captures anything a game would and should ever have to. Fun.

9/10 personally
7/10 as a game itself

reviewText:
You will find Postal 2 on numerous sites and gaming lists as the most conversial game of all time. I recently obtained a newer PC & after finally getting this game again I can happily say, it has aged gloriously! Postal 2 completely blows it's nose with the first game and it's story and starts something hilarious. While Postal was about the dude going on a city wide killing spree featuring dark psychotic tones, the sequel is the dude just trying to live out a week in his city while dealing with a completely exaggerated but hilarious enviroment. The levels are broken up into days of the week and it's semi free roam, meaning you can go where you want but certain areas don't open up until a later day. The game, at first on the easier difficulties, really is as violent as you are until your forced to deal with one of the many hate groups you encounter over the week. Postal 2 has alot of replay value too, when you beat it you can play through again in Enhanced mode which just makes the game pure gold.

The Steam Support for this game is incredible. 68+a few hidden Achievements,Multiplayer,Workshop Support, and Steam Cards. Also comes with a Level Editor!

Performance wise the game looks great for being over 10 years old! Win 8.1 No complaints

reviewText:
Postal 2 is one of my favorite games of all time.

There are quite a few misconceptions regarding Postal 2. I've talked to people that have never played the game and they thought all you did in the game was kill people. That is incorrect. Yes, there is pretty much no story, only mundane tasks like cashing in your check from work, and picking up your laundry. A lot of the time, something crazy happens, like while you're cashing in your paycheck, the bank get's robbed and the cops and robbers get into a shootout, or video game conservatives raid the game developer's HQ that you just got fired from.

Yes, there are tons of weapons. Yes, the game is VERY gorey. But in a way, Postal 2 is less violent than Grand Theft Auto. Grand Theft Auto has missions that literally tell you to go to X, kill Y. Postal 2 doesn't. It gives you a very large arsonal of weapons, but that's it. They never tell you to USE those weapons.

The game is only as violent as you are."

Now
date: onto why this is one of my favorite games of all time...\n\nIt's bloody fun
recommended: no pun intended.\n\nThere have been days where I have just felt awful. I had a bad day
hoursPlayed: and just wanted to release some stress. So I'd hop on Postal 2
voteText: and go on a murderous rampage. About 30 minutes - an hour later
helpfulPercent: i'd feel refreshed and in a better mood. This game is the greatest stress ball ever created.\n\nThe combat is fun
votesHelpful: the AI isn't very good
votesTotal: but still serviceable. The enemies range from angry protestors
votesFunny: rednecks
commentsCount: and of course
column16: police.\n\nI really like the police in this game. They act like actual police
column18: where it's more of a parody of police. Also
column19: you have the option to surrendor and get arrested. You are then placed in a cell
column20: with all of your weapons stripped away. You can break out and steal your weapons back.\n\nI also really like the map. It's not very big
column21: but certainly not small. Especially considering you only walk in this game
column22: there are no vehicles. You can find some pretty messed up things through out the map. I once found a backyard that had an entire family with their bodies burned to a bloody crisp
column23: with a rotting cow head placed on; what looked like a religous artifact.\n\nThis game is very bloody and gorey
column24: but you can disable it if it's too intense for you.\n\nRunning With Scissors earned my respect from this game. They didn't give a damn about political correctness
column25: or what people thought of them and the game. They simply made the game they wanted.\n\nWhile I absolutely love this game
column26: and know a few people that do as well... I also know a few people that despise this game. I really can't recommend this game to everybody. I can see why people would be offended by this game
column27:
but just remember... It's a computer game.

8.5/10.

reviewText: What can I say. I bought Postal 2 11+ years ago in a gamestop store for $50 when it was only a singleplayer game and I was just freshly addicted to pc gaming. Was hooked on the game from the 1st 5 minutes in as it was the most outragous game I'd ever played at that point. Hacking heads off with a shovel and kicking them around like soccer balls, ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ in people's faces until they puked, pouring gas all over a bunch of alternative lifestyle" people dancing in a gay bar and setting them on fire
date: training stray dogs to attack anyone who attacked me.....and that's just during day 1.\nBasically you live 5 days in the life of "The Postal Dude" and although you have a few chores to do each day that allow you to progress to the next day
recommended: the game is totally non-linear and open world. You play how you want to play and at what pace and spend as much time as you want exploring and discovering (and there's lot's to discover) as you want.\nThen they finally released "Share the Pain"
hoursPlayed: the version of Postal 2 that included multiplayer. Even though the network code wasn't the greatest and it was always a little buggy it quickly became my most played game for the next couple years. I started a clan
voteText: started running game servers for the 1st time
helpfulPercent: and eventually learned the unreal editor and made probably around 30 custom mp maps for the game.\nAnyway to make a long story medium
votesHelpful: even though the multiplayer community is scarce and pretty much nothing but super modded servers
votesTotal: the single player part of the game is well worth $10 any day of the week. The game is still being updated and patched often more then 11 years later and RWS is about to release a new expansion to the story/game which is looking even better then the original.\nIf you aren't easily offended
votesFunny: love to laugh your ♥♥♥ off
commentsCount: and want to ♥♥♥♥ in a cops face then buy this game now!"

reviewText:
Go to the shop and buy some milk - How many people will you kill along the way? How many cats will you penetrate? Will you really need that chainsaw? Where did you get that severed head? When did you become addicted to crack? These are just some of the questions you'll have to answer in Postal 2.

If you've ever wanted to cut someones head off and then urinate on it, guess what? You're NOT alone! In Postal 2 you can meet like minded people, share tips on how best to humilate, abuse, mutilate and cause general suffering to.... Anyone!

Personally, I enjoy urinating in someones face untill they start vomiting violently, then I give them a full charge from a tazer and watch them lose control of thier bladder while convulsing on the floor in a puddle of thier own vomit and urine. Then I take a lovely little break, smoke a crack pipe, eat a slice of 'za, maybe even have a doughnut and then it's back to work. I'll take the hedge trimmers I borrowed from a neighbor (after I cut his head off with a machete) and remove thier hands and feet one by one, if they survive that I'll take off thier arms and legs and sometimes, they even survive that, so I'll cut them in half.

Once a cop survived! No arms, no legs and cut in half, as his guts slowly started to seep out and he was crying, I thought I better not miss an oppertunity, so I dropped my trousers and bust one out up the wall, when I was done, shame ejected, I covered him in petrol, throw a match on him, and left. I had made it to the shop and bought some milk, now I just needed to get home......

But that's another story........

Postal 2! It's ****ing bat**** crazy! You'd be crazy to not play it! You'd be crazy if you played it! You'd be crazy to listen to me! I'm off my med's! You'd be crazy too if your wife ran away with your grandma! (They didn't make it far though.....) haha, hahaha HAHAHAHhahAHhahHAHhAAAAAAAHHH WHEN DID MY LIFE GO SO WRONG?! WHAT HAPPENED?!? THE LAST THING I REMEMBER IS BUYING SOME GAME ON STEAM! STEAM!! STAY AWAY FROM STEAMMMMMMMM! NO I DON'T WANT TO GO BACK IN THE STRIAGHT JACKET! NO DRUGS! PLEASE, NO NEEDLES! NOOOOOOOO AHHHH NOOOOOOOOO!!!

.......

zzzzZZZZZZzzzz........zzzzzZZZZZzzzzzz......

Postal 2! Where phychos meet in crowded cells!

reviewText:
Probably Postal 2 is the only game that was banned in most countries for its gross, abhorrent content. I'll elaborate what this means: you can unzip your pants and pee on all the citizens you encounter, there's animal cruelty, all kinds of racial and ethnic stereotypes you can imagine, there's even vomiting and wherever you go there's a lot of violence.

In the game you play as the Dude (cool but not as cool as Big Lebowsky's Dude), a fellow who needs to survive one week. One week in his small town with the general daily tasks such as picking up the hard-earned wages or buying milk or taking back the book to the library. But something always happens: when you go to the church to confess your sins, for example, Arab terrorists attack. The game allows you to go wherever you want and whenever you want: essentially, it feels like a non-linear game. Once you reach your destination a cutscene takes place and you follow a linear path after which you are back in town free to go to the place you desire.

The game looks horrendous but it is understandable as it is a more than 10-year old software. Even at the time of its release it looked outdated. Still, it is a fun game and the Steam version comes with expansion packs and achievements. If it is discounted, it is easily the best purchase currently on Steam!

reviewText:
I've always heard a lot about this game, and been intrigued by it due to it's credentials for controversy. Finally decided to buy it and try for myself. I wasn't expecting much in terms of gameplay but am I in for a surprise. 10 years on and I have to say I haven't played a game this fun for a long while. Yes, it's very crude and sets out to offend, and production values are pretty low, but that's actually the point, and in fact where the wacky fun comes in. I don't play video games to be polictically correct!

The very wide variety of weapons and items in an open world with plenty of NPC in-fighting allows for creative play which IMHO is unmatched by any game in recent history. The fact that you can wee on yourself to put out a flesh fire is unprecedented (and dare I say, unlikely to be replicated) in gaming history and reason enough to experience this game.

They simply don't make games like this anymore. If only someone has the guts to make and, most of all, publish something like this today!

reviewText:
Probably Postal 2 is the only game that was banned in most countries for its gross, abhorrent content. I'll elaborate what this means: you can unzip your pants and pee on all the citizens you encounter, there's animal cruelty, all kinds of racial and ethnic stereotypes you can imagine, there's even vomiting and wherever you go there's a lot of violence.

In the game you play as the Dude (cool but not as cool as Big Lebowsky's Dude), a fellow who needs to survive one week. One week in his small town with the general daily tasks such as picking up the hard-earned wages or buying milk or taking back the book to the library. But something always happens: when you go to the church to confess your sins, for example, Arab terrorists attack. The game allows you to go wherever you want and whenever you want: essentially, it feels like a non-linear game. Once you reach your destination a cutscene takes place and you follow a linear path after which you are back in town free to go to the place you desire.

The game looks horrendous but it is understandable as it is a more than 10-year old software. Even at the time of its release it looked outdated. Still, it is a fun game and the Steam version comes with expansion packs and achievements. If it is discounted, it is easily the best purchase currently on Steam!
voteText: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Here we have the finest example of American game design, from quite possibly the finest company in the industry. Everything about this game just screams quality: the vast array of weapons, the irreverent humor, and especially the choices you can make. Like murdering anything that gets in your way? Please do. Maybe you're a peaceful person? Everything can be done without shedding a drop of innocent blood. What Running With Scissors has done here is create more than just a game. Having played this game, I can say that this is more than just a fun-filled, gory romp through a brilliantly satirical American city; it's a philosophical statement. A modern day transcendentalist piece, if it pleases you. Still, a great number of close-minded people do not see this masterpiece for what it truly is.\n\nMany simply take the game at face value and see nothing but another violent video game for another crazy loner to take inspiration from. You might be one of these people, but if you aren't, then it's likely that you can also see the brilliant charicature of our society that Running With Scissors has implanted into this glorious bundle of code. For what it's worth, I have to say that this game is quite possibly the greatest I have ever played. Anything else pales in comparison to this magnificently crafted, engaging shooter. Maybe you still aren't convinced? I'd say take a look at the immense value here: buying this game gives you hours and hours of fun action, with Steam workshop support to keep the fun going, not to mention that Running With Scissors still updates the game after 11 years, and the game is constantly on sale for a very, very reasonable price. Like fun, value, and perhaps a deeper, philosophical statement on our society and humanity at large? You need to play this game.

reviewText:
Go to the shop and buy some milk - How many people will you kill along the way? How many cats will you penetrate? Will you really need that chainsaw? Where did you get that severed head? When did you become addicted to crack? These are just some of the questions you'll have to answer in Postal 2.

If you've ever wanted to cut someones head off and then urinate on it, guess what? You're NOT alone! In Postal 2 you can meet like minded people, share tips on how best to humilate, abuse, mutilate and cause general suffering to.... Anyone!

Personally, I enjoy urinating in someones face untill they start vomiting violently, then I give them a full charge from a tazer and watch them lose control of thier bladder while convulsing on the floor in a puddle of thier own vomit and urine. Then I take a lovely little break, smoke a crack pipe, eat a slice of 'za, maybe even have a doughnut and then it's back to work. I'll take the hedge trimmers I borrowed from a neighbor (after I cut his head off with a machete) and remove thier hands and feet one by one, if they survive that I'll take off thier arms and legs and sometimes, they even survive that, so I'll cut them in half.

Once a cop survived! No arms, no legs and cut in half, as his guts slowly started to seep out and he was crying, I thought I better not miss an oppertunity, so I dropped my trousers and bust one out up the wall, when I was done, shame ejected, I covered him in petrol, throw a match on him, and left. I had made it to the shop and bought some milk, now I just needed to get home......

But that's another story........

Postal 2! It's ****ing bat**** crazy! You'd be crazy to not play it! You'd be crazy if you played it! You'd be crazy to listen to me! I'm off my med's! You'd be crazy too if your wife ran away with your grandma! (They didn't make it far though.....) haha, hahaha HAHAHAHhahAHhahHAHhAAAAAAAHHH WHEN DID MY LIFE GO SO WRONG?! WHAT HAPPENED?!? THE LAST THING I REMEMBER IS BUYING SOME GAME ON STEAM! STEAM!! STAY AWAY FROM STEAMMMMMMMM! NO I DON'T WANT TO GO BACK IN THE STRIAGHT JACKET! NO DRUGS! PLEASE, NO NEEDLES! NOOOOOOOO AHHHH NOOOOOOOOO!!!

.......

zzzzZZZZZZzzzz........zzzzzZZZZZzzzzzz......

Postal 2! Where phychos meet in crowded cells!

reviewText:
What should we say about this game? It's oldschool for sure. Don't expect amazing graphics or some astonishing story line. Let's get in to it... You play as a regular guy in a regular... CRAZY TOWN. You just want to do your stuff but there are always crazy people who have nothing better to do than make your week tough. Therefor you have the chance to protect yourself and to kick some as.s.
Things you're going to do in this game: kill people with many kinds of weapons, pis.s on people, kick dogs, use cats as silencer, kill some more people, do your the stuff from your day list, befriend dogs, destroy cars, kill some elephants, terrorists, protestors, smoke crack, etc...
For some, it might get too repetitive after a while, but really, this game is only about letting off some steam, nothing serious.
It's fun, it's vintage/oldschool/classic game. And if you see it on sale for 2€ just grab it, it's worth it.
7/10

reviewText: Fun! A classic game full of violence and opportunity to get very politically incorrect. This game can be quite offensive, but that's actually part of the whole thing. Nothing is sacred here, and you're virtually free to do whatever you want, as violently as you want it! This game follows the Postal Dude as he goes through various errands for his highly demanding wife through the week, and the apocalypse weekend. Plenty of politically incorrect humor abounds here, and the devs even make fun of themselves from the get go. You can tell these guys have a wild sense of humor, and the game gets pretty hilariously violent. I consider it a nice cult classic you should definetly try if you're up for an FPS that's rude, insensitive, and makes fun of everything.\n\nYou know a game is good when you can pick it up 10 years after it's initial release, and still find it incredibly fun and engaging. The best part is, it just recieved a bunch of huge updates recently! Tons of new features, new weapons, and ongoing bug fixes! This definetly makes this game even more worthwhile then it allready was.

reviewText:
What can I say about the game that I have completed over 15 times and I still enjoy playing to this very day?

The beauty about Postal 2 is that it gives you a true choice. For example, one of your first errands buying milk can be completed in 3 ways:

1) Walk inside the shop, get milk, wait in a line, pay 5$ for it.
2) Walk inside the shop, get milk, don't bother waiting in the line and just steal the milk.
3) Walk inside the shop, get milk, kill everyone in the shop, get into the back room and steal everything you can.

After completing the game, you can replay it. On higher difficulties or with a different play style.

There are fun achievements, that actually make you play the game in a different way.

There is multilayer and there is a strong modding community that makes awesome maps and mods.

And finally. you help making Postal 4 a reality. A true sequel that the fans deserve. Something that RWS will develop in the house and make it even more awesome than Postal 2 (if such a thing is even possible).

Do I need to say more?

TL;DR Version: Buy it! Or I will follow you home and kill your dog. I'm not kidding. :P

reviewText: Postal 2 is one of those games that makes for a great stress reliever. If you have one of those jobs, especially in the customer service field, where you have to deal with imbeciles on a daily basis to the point where you've felt ready to snap, then Postal 2 is definitely for you. You don't even need to follow the storyline to enjoy the game. You can play at your leisure and just have fun blowing fools away or tearing them a new one. There is a wide array of weapons to choose from. Everything from a shovel to napalm, M-16s and SMGs to a boomerang-machete and even the sickle of the Grim Reaper himself. Though I will warn of animal cruelty and violence prevalent in the game series. The game series is amazing. I love it, though it isn't for the faint of heart. Enjoy!
voteText: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Postal 2 takes everything you love in video games (like peeing on enemy corpses that you've slaughtered and playing fetch using a severed head with your best friend to name but a few) and integrates it seamlessly in an open-world anarchist humour-fest.

Do I pay for things and conform to society? Or do I smash their heads in and get things done however I see fit? Do I set them on fire then proceed to pee on them to extinguish the fire only to stab them repeatedly with a pair of scissors? Do I run and hope for the best or do I shove a shotgun barrel up a kittens sacred region as a make-shift silencer and take everyone out? These are but a few of the vast choices you will be making, and at the end of the day who said anyone had to die? It's all about completing the tasks, whichever way you see fit.

While the regular Postal 2 gameplay is quite mellow, if you're looking for serious action (Resident Evil meets Silent Hill) from start till finish that will keep you on the edge of your seat and which resembles more of a quick-paced Half-Life run I'd thoroughly recommend the Apocalypse Weekend mode (after you've completed the main Monday-Friday run of course, to get into the swing of things as Postal 2 isn't your normal shooter and takes a bit of getting used to).

All in all, for a game that was released in 2003 (over 10 years ago!) the constant updates (up until this very year, over 10 years later) have only improved the content tenfold, from better graphical support (widescreen now available!) to bug fixes and gameplay improvement you're guaranteed a smooth transition into what is certainly one of the best first person shooters around. Do yourself a favour and give Postal 2 a try, you can't go wrong.

reviewText:
Postal 2 is a game that tried very hard to ensure that if you don't leave completely offended, you will either
a) have a good chuckle and laugh a great deal or,
b) see the completely flawed game mechanics and truthfully... abysmal game veiled under some uncreative, yet funny, game comedy.
So obviously this game is not for everyone, specifically anyone who is easily offended, by either the ability to urinate as an attack of sorts, maybe the odd run in with drugs as a major health increase, or perhaps the major idea of the game being that life's ultimate short-cut is extrenous violence.
But if you can take this game with a good humour, it is a very odd corner of the video game world that should be experienced once in a while.
Yes, as a game, its pretty bad, the shooting is clunky, you have many different items in your inventory and yet no real way to easily access them, and the goals are a bit vague and confusing at times, making you guess or give up and drop a few pedestrians and urinate on their corpses.
It has a charm though, very quirky, and with a few really interesting points in the days, usually ending in hilarity or a side-ways look of judgement from whomever notices you playing it.
If you can get it for around 5 bucks, it can be worth it, but don't expect an award winner.
5.4/10

If you've ever wanted to cut someones head off and then urinate on it, guess what? You're NOT alone! In Postal 2 you can meet like minded people, share tips on how best to humilate, abuse, mutilate and cause general suffering to.... Anyone!

Personally, I enjoy urinating in someones face untill they start vomiting violently, then I give them a full charge from a tazer and watch them lose control of thier bladder while convulsing on the floor in a puddle of thier own vomit and urine. Then I take a lovely little break, smoke a crack pipe, eat a slice of 'za, maybe even have a doughnut and then it's back to work. I'll take the hedge trimmers I borrowed from a neighbor (after I cut his head off with a machete) and remove thier hands and feet one by one, if they survive that I'll take off thier arms and legs and sometimes, they even survive that, so I'll cut them in half.

Once a cop survived! No arms, no legs and cut in half, as his guts slowly started to seep out and he was crying, I thought I better not miss an oppertunity, so I dropped my trousers and bust one out up the wall, when I was done, shame ejected, I covered him in petrol, throw a match on him, and left. I had made it to the shop and bought some milk, now I just needed to get home......

But that's another story........

Postal 2! It's ****ing bat**** crazy! You'd be crazy to not play it! You'd be crazy if you played it! You'd be crazy to listen to me! I'm off my med's! You'd be crazy too if your wife ran away with your grandma! (They didn't make it far though.....) haha, hahaha HAHAHAHhahAHhahHAHhAAAAAAAHHH WHEN DID MY LIFE GO SO WRONG?! WHAT HAPPENED?!? THE LAST THING I REMEMBER IS BUYING SOME GAME ON STEAM! STEAM!! STAY AWAY FROM STEAMMMMMMMM! NO I DON'T WANT TO GO BACK IN THE STRIAGHT JACKET! NO DRUGS! PLEASE, NO NEEDLES! NOOOOOOOO AHHHH NOOOOOOOOO!!!

.......

zzzzZZZZZZzzzz........zzzzzZZZZZzzzzzz......

Postal 2! Where phychos meet in crowded cells!

This game is called Postal 2.
It's selling point is that it's only as violent as you.

but past the face

You start on day one with a search for guns
and get your paycheck for your day to day funds.
You pick up some milk, it could be smooth as silk so long as you don't just grab it and run.
Then it's off to the bank and you deal with some stank when the PAYDAY crew come in loud and the cops be not proud.

I'd tell you some more, but just buy it, you ♥♥♥♥♥. It'll turn your crank like an old german tank tearing down a fragile goods store.

reviewText:
Im going to be blunt with this game, no tagine or anything, if there was the option on here to give BOTH a thumbs up and a thumbs down, that would be the best way to go along with it.

This is because that this game happens to mix some really great gaming goodness along with a whole load of poor design choices mixed in with a heavy dose of content that pushes the taste boundaries heavily.

Lets take the good first. The design of the main game is great, wandering around the town feels great, theres plenty to explore in the sandbox world, plenty to see and find and loads of hidden easter eggs. At no point does the gamespace feel samey or confusing. The actual structure of the main game works brilliantly too.

Each day you are given seemingly 'Mundane' tasks to complete such as 'Get Milk', 'Get Paycheck' and the like. However it openly gives you the option on what YOU want to do to complete the missions. Do you want to be a pacifist and try and run through the game without killing? You can do that! Do you want to just go 'Postal' and shoot up the place? Yep! Do you want to cash yoyr 'Paycheck' by robbing the bank? Its all there.

Where the bad comes in however is some of the gameplay, the actual engine isnt smooth, there isnt really any music of any note at all and the graphics have aged quite badly over the years. Bugs are aplenty as well, both annoying bugs and gamebreaking bugs are present with plenty of clipping, invisible walls, AI bugging out and wanted levels that refuse to vanish no matter what you do (or dont do). The other big 'Bad' comes with the weekend addon that destroys the open ended gameplay of the original week and forces you down a specific path.

Oh and lets not forget the 'Offensive' nature of the game which may put some people off totally. Here we have blood, sex, drugs, using cats as silencers, camp stereotypes, arab stereotypes, urine, feces and the (now made even more potentially offensive given he is dead) appearance of Gary Coleman (And yes, you can murder him ingame too). Essentially avoid if you are offended easily or even moderately.

And that about wraps it up. Once again. Thumbs up, Thumbs down and hard to just say right out if its bad or good. Hope this description has helped with things if you are planning to buy!

reviewText: Postal 2 is easily my favorite game that I have on steam. Granted, I don't have a lot of games to choose from on here, but still. The game is the old style of FPS that I like (as in you have hit points and don't die in about two shots) and it's just a fun game. It's not of the easily offended and the humor is a bit dated. I only have a couple gripes with the game, one being the last two days feeling off and tacked on and the other being that after I play it for a while, the game crashes. That could have to do with my laptop overheating but I don't know. I'll be getting the DLC once I get the money for it.

reviewText: Postal 2 is a fantastic example of a do whatever you want sandbox game.  It's also one of the funniest games I've ever played.  Nothing is off limits for Running With Scissors (The guys who made the game).  It's really offensive in so many ways.  Wanna put a cat on the end of your shotgun to use as a silencer?  Go ahead.  Wanna throw pairs of scissors at people?  Why not? Wanna chop somebodys head off and then pee on their corpse?.......Well yeah, you can also do that.  I think everybody can find something in this game that they enjoy.  There are so many weapons and so many movie references that that fill this game that I just couldn't stop playing it till the end.

reviewText:
This game is just hilarious.

This game is the perfect game for people, that need to reduce their aggressions after a hard day, or just want to play a game without any sense.

Even, if the graphics aren't the greatest (the game came out in 2003, so stop arguing about how bad the graphics are),
you can have a lots of fun while playing it.

But..(here it comes), also this game have some bugs, like people that walk around, when you have chopped their legs off (but only for a few seconds).

Also, on some pc's it could be, that objects like houses , Boxes (and sometimes npc's) just dissapear.

Another problem is the multiplayer, don't misunderstand me, but sometimes there are some connection Problems and other Problems, like modded serves that you can't connect to or (just sometimes) hacker. But on the other hand, the multiplayer mode can be very funny (and bloody).

So, to say with my final words:

If you (older people) Loved this game back in your days, you should totally buy it (if you don't own it) and if you don't mind some issues with the game.

But younger people should also buy the game, not only because it's a classic, because also it's really funny to play, because you can just shut down your brain, while playing and enjoy masses of mindless Violence (and if you love old games) . Even if there are some things, that mind disturb you while playing

reviewText: Postal 2 is an open world first person shooter. Calling it a first person shooter is at least the most fitting term for the game since although it features a lot of melee weapons and can even be finished without shooting at all - at least on lower difficulty settings. It is very different from the first Postal game which was a rather dark top down shooter that was broken  up into various levels where the sole objective was to take out all opponents.\n\nPostal 2 takes place in a small town called Paradise". You play as Postal Dude (that is his actual name
date: I swear) who lives in a trailer with his wife and his dog. He is rather unsatisfied with his current life. He is completely broke
recommended: he is the only person in the neighborhood who lives in a trailer
hoursPlayed: his wife constantly yells at him
voteText: his car barely works anymore. He just started at a new job in games development (guess which company) though. Will that help him to get his life back in order?\n\nThe gameplay of Postal 2 is split up into five days
helpfulPercent: starting on Monday. Every day Postal Dude gets a number of tasks that must be completed to proceed to the next day. Many tasks are given by his wife but some are his own decision. A majority of the task are rather mundane
votesHelpful: for example cashing in your paycheck
votesTotal: buying milk
votesFunny: getting a christmas tree or buying meat for a barbeque or going to your uncle Dave's birthday party. While none of this sound like a pretty exciting  activity the town of Paradise is full of people who would go ballistic over the most trivial things. So even the most mundane task may end up with Postal Dude either running for his life or being forced to kill everybody in the vicinity. At the beginning of the game you just have to be aware of random people starting fights but every day after completing certain quests Postal Dude gets an additional group of enemies who hate his guts so much that they would attack him on sight without thinking twice. Luckily the law enforcement is just as violent as the other citizens and might be a great ally in cases like that. If you start funny business yourself however they will not hesitate shooting you either. You can tackle all tasks at your own pace and explore the town. Exploration is really rewarding since you might find weapons and items that would not be available yet otherwise and might give you a real edge over your enemies. Also
commentsCount: there are small eastereggs jokes and references hidden all over the place.\n\nWhile the first Postal game featured rather dark themes Postal 2 is full of silly over the top humour. Also it might be the most offensive game ever created. The game depicts various groups of society as exaggerated stereotypical caricatures: Censorship advocates
column16: Christians
column18: gays
column19: bankers
column20: animal rights activists
column22: New Age religions - nobody leaves unscathed. (I will tell you a little secret: You can lure policemen by dropping a donut on the ground.) If I needed to compare the humour of Postal 2 to anything I would probably say South Park.\n\nOn his quest to survive the week Postal Dude can rely on a huge arsenal of tools and weapons. Melee weapons like tasers
column25: machetes or sledgehammers as well as ranged weapons like scissors
column31: infectious cow heads (which spread an unpleasant disease) and molotov cocktails. On top of that you can just kick people. There's another "weapon" in Postal Dude's arsenal that should not be left unmentioned: Pee. He can open his pants and just let go. It does not deal any damage but it can stun people briefly if you hit them right in the face. Also
column32: it causes people to either scream at you
column34: attack you or just puke. While this sounds like nothing than an easteregg peeing can be vital to your survival. Fire based weapons are extremely dangerous and when you ever find yourself being on fire you better pee straight up in the air so you can extinguish the flames. It can also be used to clear flames blocking your path or to extinguish burning people other than yourself.\n\nAs mentioned before there are various tools and items to utilize. Dog biscuits can be used to befriend dogs and make them follow you around. Catnip can NOT be used to befriend cats. Instead you can consume it yourself to slow down the world around you. Cats however can be picked up and either be used as erratic tornadoes of fur and claws (keep your distance) or as silencers to put on your shotgun or assault rifle. A fishing radar comes in handy to show you the position of nearby enemies. Also there are various items that restore health like donuts
column35: pizza or "Health Pipes" - be warned though
column36:
they are addictive.

There is one gripe I have with the game. Some weapons feel really underwhelming. There is basically no point to some of the melee weapons (for example the shovel) as soon as you found a higher tier one. Also the standard shotgun and assault rifle feel to weak.

The town of Paradise feels incredibly alive. Bystanders will walk around the place
column37: talk to each other and either go their merry way or start a fight. If they see corpses they will run away or start vomiting. If they see you in an embarassing situation they will laugh at you. Also
column38: it is entirely possible that huge fights break out without the player having done anything to cause them. Considering when the game came out this is impressively done and really conveys what kind of town we are talking about here. The title Postal does not need to refer solely to the main character but can also be seen as representative of Paradise and its citizens. Postal Dude would have all reason to give up and despair but he rather reacts with snarky sarcasm which makes him kind of likeable. I he goes postal eventually depends on the player but believe me
column39: this town will put your patience to a test.\n\nThis re-released version of Postal 2 comes with the add-on Apocalypse Weekend that covers Saturday and Sunday. The playstyle is a little different though. Apokalypse Weekend still has the humour of the base game as well as some really neat new ideas and mechanics. Sadly it drops the open world exploration aspect completely and often comes down to tunnel shooter levels and arena fights. It is also a problem that the two most "standard shooter like" levels are among the longest of the expansion. Do not get me wrong though. It is well worth playing
column40: I just feel that it cannot hold a candle to the base game.\n\nFor the re-release of Postal 2 the developers added several weapons
column41: mechanics and cosmetic tweaks. Some of those had been featured before in community made mods. The developers really went and asked the modders if they were okay with the mods being included in the main game. That's what I call being in touch with the fans.\n\nAlso
column42: after the re-release being financially quite successful the developers decided that they could afford to work on a second expansion pack for Postal 2 which is by now released and available as DLC. As far as I know releasing an official expansion ten years after the base game came out is completely unheard of. If this doesn't proof incredible dedication to the fanbase I do not what does.\n\nWhat's more
column43:
the expansion called Paradise Lost is much closer to the base game than Apocalypse Weekend was. It also features additional content and improvements some of which have been retroactively added to the base game.

Long story short if you have not played Postal 2 yet you should give this classic a try. If the humour is not for you or you are easily offended you might not like it. Otherwise it is well worth your time. If you have played Postal 2 before and liked it you should also pick this version up since it is a step up from the original version in every area.

More reviews here"

reviewText:
Ok, I have to admit that this is one of the best video games I have ever played in my entire life. People who never played GTA before (like me) would totally get a kick out of this game.

Despite its many difficulty options, POSTAL 2 is a very easy game in my opinion. Only some bystanders have weapons, and the police officers just try to arrest you for no reason! But hey, you play as the Postal Dude, an ordinary guy who just wants to finish his errands and go home, But in the eyes of Paradise's citizens,  they see the Dude as a no good smartass Hitler type tyrant. Well, thats kind of true, if you played the original POSTAL game from 1997 and witnessed how he noticed HE was a bleedin' killer himself, andhe didn't care!

What I really like about this game is that it's very GTA like and realistic. You can explore the open world of Paradise, and if you have any maps installed, you can explore those too. You can get suited up with guns and ♥♥♥♥, terrorizing the citizens and fighting the cops and trying to gey the hilarious toy character Krotchy down. And once you finish the game (the original game, not counting Apocalypse Weekend), you unlock cheats, and you can turn bystanders into Gary Colemans or Osamas, or load yoursef up with guns and an unlimited supply of ammo, and even get bonus health stuff whenever you want!

And I wanna say the funniest thing about POSTAL 2 is that you can ♥♥♥♥ on people, and during the petition mission I asked a bystander to sign it and they said no nd I coaxed them three times, still said np and tats when as punishment, I made their day. I peed on them :D

100000000/10 Would ♥♥♥♥ on Gary Coleman again

reviewText:
Bought this game as a filler between games;  and after a few hours of this anarchic FPS shooter under my belt....I'm finding that this is an immersive game that is soaked with modern American societal  satire.

The police presence is ever present to protect a town named Paradise" against the external threat of the Taliban attacks and their own citizens (enter the Postal Dude). The town size is just right and prolification of firearms is magnificent in the "home of the brave."

Love the achievements and having fun earning these. Definetly worth the dosh."

reviewText:
-Starting the game for the first time-
Nice intro! puking people ok uhm oh, that's me, let's play ~

I killed my dog after peeing on his face, starting a new game... that won't happen again.
* 15 secs later*
My dog was killed by some random dude with a shotgun. I killed him using a shovel and proceed to profanate his corpse.



---------Now the actual note---------

An old game, sure it is. Poor graphics? yeah, also some bugs and errors BUT, beside all those flaws, is still being an awesome psycho-simulator! The gameplay is the important thing here.

reviewText: Fun! A classic game full of violence and opportunity to get very politically incorrect. This game can be quite offensive, but that's actually part of the whole thing. Nothing is sacred here, and you're virtually free to do whatever you want, as violently as you want it! This game follows the Postal Dude as he goes through various errands for his highly demanding wife through the week, and the apocalypse weekend. Plenty of politically incorrect humor abounds here, and the devs even make fun of themselves from the get go. You can tell these guys have a wild sense of humor, and the game gets pretty hilariously violent. I consider it a nice cult classic you should definetly try if you're up for an FPS that's rude, insensitive, and makes fun of everything.\n\nYou know a game is good when you can pick it up 10 years after it's initial release, and still find it incredibly fun and engaging. The best part is, it just recieved a bunch of huge updates recently! Tons of new features, new weapons, and ongoing bug fixes! This definetly makes this game even more worthwhile then it allready was.

reviewText:
Go to the shop and buy some milk - How many people will you kill along the way? How many cats will you penetrate? Will you really need that chainsaw? Where did you get that severed head? When did you become addicted to crack? These are just some of the questions you'll have to answer in Postal 2.

If you've ever wanted to cut someones head off and then urinate on it, guess what? You're NOT alone! In Postal 2 you can meet like minded people, share tips on how best to humilate, abuse, mutilate and cause general suffering to.... Anyone!

Personally, I enjoy urinating in someones face untill they start vomiting violently, then I give them a full charge from a tazer and watch them lose control of thier bladder while convulsing on the floor in a puddle of thier own vomit and urine. Then I take a lovely little break, smoke a crack pipe, eat a slice of 'za, maybe even have a doughnut and then it's back to work. I'll take the hedge trimmers I borrowed from a neighbor (after I cut his head off with a machete) and remove thier hands and feet one by one, if they survive that I'll take off thier arms and legs and sometimes, they even survive that, so I'll cut them in half.

Once a cop survived! No arms, no legs and cut in half, as his guts slowly started to seep out and he was crying, I thought I better not miss an oppertunity, so I dropped my trousers and bust one out up the wall, when I was done, shame ejected, I covered him in petrol, throw a match on him, and left. I had made it to the shop and bought some milk, now I just needed to get home......

But that's another story........

Postal 2! It's ****ing bat**** crazy! You'd be crazy to not play it! You'd be crazy if you played it! You'd be crazy to listen to me! I'm off my med's! You'd be crazy too if your wife ran away with your grandma! (They didn't make it far though.....) haha, hahaha HAHAHAHhahAHhahHAHhAAAAAAAHHH WHEN DID MY LIFE GO SO WRONG?! WHAT HAPPENED?!? THE LAST THING I REMEMBER IS BUYING SOME GAME ON STEAM! STEAM!! STAY AWAY FROM STEAMMMMMMMM! NO I DON'T WANT TO GO BACK IN THE STRIAGHT JACKET! NO DRUGS! PLEASE, NO NEEDLES! NOOOOOOOO AHHHH NOOOOOOOOO!!!

.......

zzzzZZZZZZzzzz........zzzzzZZZZZzzzzzz......

Postal 2! Where phychos meet in crowded cells!

reviewText:
IN BRIEF: Postal 2 is a great game and a great commentary of what games are supposed to be. After nearly 160 hours of playtime, I'm still not done. The game's extremely short length is balanced by the excellent use of steam achievements, frequent updates since its 2012 re-release, and its bizarre DLC.

----

STORY: As silly as it is for me to write this, the story in Postal 2 is fairly subtle. Whether or not that is intentionally so is another issue altogether. You play as the Postal Dude getting his weekly chores done as the world around him gets more and more hostile and strange. It plays well into the themes of player choice and the motto: It's only as violent as you are". The story however
date: is less about the Postal Dude himself and more about the developers' views on video games and political correctness (PC): Modern life is suddenly interrupted by suicide bombings in the post-9/11 world in which the game was released; videogame protestors are mocked as violent patrons of Joe Lieberman; The 1990’s intersection of appropriateness and coarse media are symbolized as crude children’s cartoons. Postal 2 is a recreation of Middle America caught between the 1990’s and the 21st century. The game’s commentary may be dated like its engine but timeless as history repeats itself and PC culture inevitably returns.\n\nTHEMES: Postal 2 mocks PC culture
voteText: and the average person
helpfulPercent: are displayed as idiotic zealots and perverted buffoons. Videogames are slighted and misunderstood and at the same time misogynistic and hostile. The game enjoys pointing when good intentions largely serve to carry out bad results. Even developers Vince Desi and Mike J are depicted as
votesHelpful: well
votesTotal: hostile idiotic misogynistic perverted buffoons. Postal 2 takes nothing seriously
votesFunny: including its own prequel: In Postal
commentsCount: Dude is out to destroy the world but in Postal 2
column16: the world is out to destroy him. The Naked Gun-style contrast of serious people in a ridiculous world gives the game its sense of levity and fun
column17: even when it’s so gruesome.\n\nGAMEPLAY: It’s easy to label Postal 2 as a crude Grand Theft Auto clone. It’s easy to assume the violent gameplay will get old within a few minutes. That all depends on what you’re looking for in a game. Yes
column18: you can kill a few minutes doing some very violent things
column19: get bored and forget about the game for a few months. You can also appreciate the world the game creates by finding unique weapons
column20: wreaking havoc
column22: and finding Tora Bora and a hidden sewer system. It’s the little jokes and easter eggs where Postal 2 shines. While you do have to go looking for these things - and it’s not a point in the game’s favor for the player to put effort into fun - you’ll enjoy the game a lot more. Did you know you can rob the police station?\n\nAs much as I recommend the game
column25: the game does suffer a bit on Wednesday and Thursday. It seems the developers didn’t know how to raise the stakes
column26: so they instead went ahead with basking in caricatures and obscene stereotypes. That said
column27: the game picks back up to a satisfying finish on Friday. There is also no purpose for money in the game if the player takes the violent route. Apocalypse Weekend puts the player in a funnier
column28: more ridiculous continuation of the world but suffers from the lack of open-world gameplay. The harder difficulties can be extremely frustrating
column30: but the result is a more satisfying game and more consistently-raised stakes for the player (FYI
column31: get the sawed-off shotgun on Thursday).\n\nSTEAM ACHIEVEMENTS: Postal 2 should be the gold standard for what achievements should be. They highlight the easter eggs and features of the game (correcting some of the gameplay issues mentioned earlier)
column32: and give the gameplay massive replay value for playing on the harder difficulty settings. It’s a great way to get players invested and immerse into the game.\n\nDLC: Apocalypse Weekend (AW) comes standard with Postal 2. While AW is more experimental and funnier than Postal 2
column33: its linear gameplay and difficulty may turn off some players. Paradise Lost (PL) is a separate purchase DLC that is pretty much a new game. While I plan to write a full review for Paradise Lost as well
column34: PL has Postal 2's themes and open-world with AW's characters and more ridiculous post-apocalypse setting. Paradise Lost is the strongest of the three games.\n\nDEVELOPERS: Running With Scissors have put a lot of work into updating this game for Steam
column35: and it’s comforting to know there are still developers out there that care about their customers and their product. Postal 2 has received several updates and bugfixes since its launch on Steam. Controller support was even added. However
column36: the game still has bugs at times
column37:
especially crashes when using the Sawed-off shotgun too much. I hope they can address this and other lingering issues.

STRONGLY RECOMMENDED

Review may be editted for future updates"

reviewText:
Postal 2 is a game that tried very hard to ensure that if you don't leave completely offended, you will either
a) have a good chuckle and laugh a great deal or,
b) see the completely flawed game mechanics and truthfully... abysmal game veiled under some uncreative, yet funny, game comedy.
So obviously this game is not for everyone, specifically anyone who is easily offended, by either the ability to urinate as an attack of sorts, maybe the odd run in with drugs as a major health increase, or perhaps the major idea of the game being that life's ultimate short-cut is extrenous violence.
But if you can take this game with a good humour, it is a very odd corner of the video game world that should be experienced once in a while.
Yes, as a game, its pretty bad, the shooting is clunky, you have many different items in your inventory and yet no real way to easily access them, and the goals are a bit vague and confusing at times, making you guess or give up and drop a few pedestrians and urinate on their corpses.
It has a charm though, very quirky, and with a few really interesting points in the days, usually ending in hilarity or a side-ways look of judgement from whomever notices you playing it.
If you can get it for around 5 bucks, it can be worth it, but don't expect an award winner.
5.4/10

reviewText: Postal 2 is easily my favorite game that I have on steam. Granted, I don't have a lot of games to choose from on here, but still. The game is the old style of FPS that I like (as in you have hit points and don't die in about two shots) and it's just a fun game. It's not of the easily offended and the humor is a bit dated. I only have a couple gripes with the game, one being the last two days feeling off and tacked on and the other being that after I play it for a while, the game crashes. That could have to do with my laptop overheating but I don't know. I'll be getting the DLC once I get the money for it.

If you're looking to laugh your ♥♥♥ off, buy this game right now.

reviewText:
It's so silly that people remember this game as the one that let the player be absolutely brutal and psychotic, to the point of preaching that it's the only way to be played.

SERIOUSLY, how many shooters let you complete them without hurting anyone or even making others do the job for you? This idea is otherworldy and unique, and yet incredibly fun, challenging and satisfying. The only way to make the nice playstyle even more saint, would be to give player tedious ways to get money legally (in game you're always unemployed, but have to pay in order to complete it). The freedom available in that section is already incredible. I bought the steam edition to have a great clean record and see if it's still fun.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=540238963

It's a bit uneven, and getting cash without hurting others is pretty much robbing. But my gameplay of not hitting, shooting, blowing up, tazing etc. people on Hard difficulty was a hell lot better than when I played it long ago, it was tense, rewarding and interesting. And because P2PL offers the pacifist playstyle again, and maintains the same obscene humour, I can't wait to play it sometime soon.

In conclusion: it's a fun, brilliantly designed, a bit amateurly executed game that's available in multiple playstyles (kind of like dishonored), and IMO it's even better when you try to limit your possibilities through challenge runs.
And it's dirt cheap, runs great and is moddable to death. Worth all my time and money.

reviewText: The Postal Dude: Only my weapon understands me. Did somebody slaughter a goat in here? Seriously, I wanna know. Buttsauce! You probably thought you weren't gonna die today? Surprise! Guns don't kill people, I do! I know what you're thinking, but the funny thing is, I don't even LIKE videogames... Here I was, just minding my own business enjoying my Second Amendment rights, and you people have to freak out on me! The gene pool is stagnant and I am the minister of chlorine. I am The Law. Hey I'm just trying to exercise my second-amendment rights here ya ♥♥♥♥in' Communist! You probably think I'm not a nice person... Please don't think I'm a bigot, I kill races equally... I suppose it would have been more politically correct to kill the women and the minorities first. Hmm... Normally, I'd expect a fancy cinematic to explain such a crucial story element. The font is nice, though. [shoots someone] That one's for your mother! [shoots another person] That one's for the Pope! [shoots another person] That one's for Bobo the space-monkey! [shoots someone else] That one's for Bobo the space-monkey! [shoots last person, bells ring] That one's 'cause I can! I was pretty hungover yesterday, but I think I remember where I work. Bless me, father, for I have sinned. No, really! I'm not kidding here! *Big* sinner. Yup! Yeah, yeah, blah, blah, just cuff me already, big man! Someone stole my donuts, and now you're all gonna pay! Ow, right in the stuff. I regret nothing.

reviewText:
Warning! Game has incredible level of violence, gore, and racism. NSFW

Dev Rating:Kind

Short Summary:
Postal 2 is 2000's game by running with siccors. The gameplay is similar to gta but with lots and lots of controversial content. it has successor Postal 3 that has negative review and to make up for that they create postal 2 dlc (decade after the main one unlike ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ dev with day one dlc ♥♥♥♥)

Gameplay:
You play as dude". with gameplay like gta playing in one small town full with weird stuff like stereotype america (with all the gun and stuff). The game pretty much tell you do A and then B. BUT you can do it whatever you want be a pacifist way (waiting in line) or gandhi way (shoot the hell of everyone). lots of weapons and enemy variety.

Engine and "technical thing":
It preety much a 2000's era graphic but the dev try bringin improvement a bit. however that said improvement make performance drop. i had a gaming pc with gtx 970 and hd 4000 laptop and somehow my laptop can run it while the gaming pc got 24fps. other than that there is no fatal bug (rare weapon stuck happens). it has good configuration and setting.

Why Should i buy this game?:
-Do you like violence in video game without any lawsuit and ethic?
-Do you like supporting good dev?
-Do you like super cheap but ten times worth it game?
-Do you like "gta" like game?
-Are you bored and want something senseless fun?

Blow arab guy with rocket launcher then chooping everyone hands of. 9/10"
voteText: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
Postal 2 is a ridiculously fun game with no plot. the purpose of the game is to survive 1 week in this crazy town.
i'm not saying that this game is bad, this game is very fun. even thought the campaign doesn't make any sense at all, i enjoyed it.
This game reminded me of the first Half - Life a little bit for some reason
This game proves that a video game without a story can be good too.
This game is not for kids because it's violent, gory and blood splatter all over the place.
i recommend this game to those who like ridiculously fun game and gory.

9/10 for me

reviewText: I got this game at 8 PM last night. Played 4 straight hours. Although the game is old, There's just something about breaking into someones home, tazing them until they p*ss themselves, killing them, dismembering them, burning their corpse, p*ssing on it, and then leaving. Long story short, best 99 cents I've ever spent.
